meanings.definition: A young man in ancient Greece, typically in his late teens or early twenties, undergoing military training.
meanings.sent1: The ephebus trained hard to become a skilled warrior.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, an ephebus was expected to serve in the military.
meanings.sent3: The young ephebus accidentally tripped during sword practice, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: His determination in training made him an ephebus to be reckoned with.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ephebus in armor was etched in his mind forever.

meanings.sent1: The ephebus enjoyed playing with his friends in the village.
meanings.sent2: As an ephebus, he was full of energy and curiosity about the world.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous ephebus played a prank on his older brother.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed through the fields, a true ephebus in his element.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the young ephebus running through the meadow was a symbol of youth and vitality.
